review: The user interface is a bit sluggish when compared to my Roku 3, but for it's size and cost it's still a great way to add streaming media to an alternate TV.  For your primary media center or TV, I would still recommend the Roku 3.
author: CodingGorilla

review: It won't let you stream anything you are watching on your iOS device or laptops, so it can't replace an Apple TV, or even a Chromecast for that matter. Not worth it.
author: Don Tripper

review: Same performance as the Roku 3, but far less cost and no games. We didn't use the games on the Roku 3 that we had, so I bought one of these for a tv in a spare room. Terrific product - cut the cable!
author: rattmeis

review: The stick did not work in the portion of the home we needed it to as it would not connect to the Internet properly.  After a frustrating hour plus of trying to install it and reading troubleshooting web pages I came across a suggestion to try to install the stick on a tv physically closer to the internet router.  I thought this was strange since all my other devices access the wifi well from the location I wanted the stick to work in.  When I tried the suggestion it worked great, connected to the Internet and was able to be installed.  I then took it back to the tv in the location of the home I needed it and it failed again.  I returned the stick.
author: Nihilism

review: Great product. Thinking about using only a Roku and cutting cable.
